title: >>> DODGEBALL 40 Rundown
body_text:
DODGEBALL 40
>> This is a true milestone event, catapulting everyone into the summer months. In further preparation for such a huge event, a theme song has been chosen. A special thanks to the legendary band Metallica for their song "Fuel".
>> There has been debate as to who would make two good captains. Mike "Sputz"'s name has been thrown out as he has never been captain before, despite a solid attendance. John Watters, another top player, has also participated in his share of events and has yet to form a team of his own. Those two are perhaps the favorites for the captains positions. DODGEBALL 40 is still a week away so anything can and will happen.
>> Decorations are a big part of the festivities as the "ten" events have shown. Obviously, expect the same at DODGEBALL 40.
>> Attendance for all "ten" events has shown tremendous success.
DODGEBALL X = 24 (10/28/05)
DODGEBALL 20 = 37 (12/30/05)
DODGEBALL 30 = 34 (03/12/06)
One can only wonder how many will take part in this soon-to-be unforgettable event. The goal is around 30 to 35.
>> Awards will see a return as they have been a major part in the success of the "ten" events. Some of the categories will be released later in the week.
>> Just adding to the hype, video taping has become a tradition since DODGEBALL 20. Will we see it at DODGEBALL 40?
>> Dan Spengeman, the man responsible for video footage, is also in the process of creating a DODGEBALL 40 Mix CD. He previously helped John Tronolone put one together for DODGEBALL 30, a CD which included many popular songs including the theme song for 30, Van Halen's "Right Now".
No matter what happens at DODGEBALL 40, expect a successful and overall fun event. Wall High School hosts this colossal event starting a half-hour earlier than normal at 6pm.
________________________________________
DODGEBALL 39, despite the hype and build towards DODGEBALL 40, will also be a memorable extravaganza. Past history has shown that the "ten" events aren't the only true success stories. DODGEBALL 39 will set records, with perhaps the inclusion of some of the recent norms like injuries and new game-types. The final stop on "The Road to 40" hits Wall High School on May 13th.
body_html:
DODGEBALL 40
>> This is a true milestone event, catapulting everyone into the summer months. In further preparation for such a huge event, a theme song has been chosen. A special thanks to the legendary band Metallica for their song "Fuel".

>> There has been debate as to who would make two good captains. Mike "Sputz"'s name has been thrown out as he has never been captain before, despite a solid attendance. John Watters, another top player, has also participated in his share of events and has yet to form a team of his own. Those two are perhaps the favorites for the captains positions. DODGEBALL 40 is still a week away so anything can and will happen.

>> Decorations are a big part of the festivities as the "ten" events have shown. Obviously, expect the same at DODGEBALL 40.

>> Attendance for all "ten" events has shown tremendous success.
DODGEBALL X = 24 (10/28/05)
DODGEBALL 20 = 37 (12/30/05)
DODGEBALL 30 = 34 (03/12/06)
One can only wonder how many will take part in this soon-to-be unforgettable event. The goal is around 30 to 35.

>> Awards will see a return as they have been a major part in the success of the "ten" events. Some of the categories will be released later in the week.

>> Just adding to the hype, video taping has become a tradition since DODGEBALL 20. Will we see it at DODGEBALL 40?

>> Dan Spengeman, the man responsible for video footage, is also in the process of creating a DODGEBALL 40 Mix CD. He previously helped John Tronolone put one together for DODGEBALL 30, a CD which included many popular songs including the theme song for 30, Van Halen's "Right Now".

No matter what happens at DODGEBALL 40, expect a successful and overall fun event. Wall High School hosts this colossal event starting a half-hour earlier than normal at 6pm.
________________________________________

DODGEBALL 39, despite the hype and build towards DODGEBALL 40, will also be a memorable extravaganza. Past history has shown that the "ten" events aren't the only true success stories. DODGEBALL 39 will set records, with perhaps the inclusion of some of the recent norms like injuries and new game-types. The final stop on "The Road to 40" hits Wall High School on May 13th.
